# VegSci.jl

`VegSci.jl` is a package containing tools for vegetation science using Julia [@bezanson2017], a growing scientific programming language which solves the 'two language problem' [@roesch2023], offering C and FORTRAN-like performance alongside the readability and user-friendliness of higher level languages such as Python and R.
`VegSci.jl` aims to impliment selected functionality found in popular vegetation science software programs/packages such as JUICE [@tichy2002], vegan [@oksanen2022], ade4 [@dray2007], indicspecies [@decaceres2009], vegclust [@decaceres2010; @decaceres2013], and vegsoup [@kaiser2021] on an ad-hoc basis, as and when required by the package authors.
`VegSci.jl` is being developed with the aim of assisting in the creation of high-performance, reproducible analytical pipelines in vegetation research [@sperandii2024].

To test `VegSci.jl`
    1.  Enter the Pkg REPL with `]`. 
    2.  Run `activate .` to activate the package environment.
    3.  Re-build the package with `build VegSci` the shortcuts Alt + J then Alt + R
    4.  Restart Julia with `exit()` and then `julia`.
    5.  Run `test --coverage`.
    6.  Run `activate` to exit the package environment.

</details>
